headline: Software Engineer
current_description:
As a backend engineer in one of the central squads at Duda, my role involved designing, developing, and maintaining server-side applications that powered our web editor products.
My responsibilities included:
- Designing and developing robust and scalable RESTful APIs using SpringBoot and Kotlin programming languages.
- Writing and maintaining unit and integration tests to ensure the quality and reliability of the codebase.
- Designing and implementing a microservices architecture and setting up communication protocols between the microservices using RESTful APIs and messaging queues.
- Collaborating with the front-end team and integrating APIs with the UI.
- Ensuring high availability and performance of the backend services through monitoring, debugging, and optimization.
- Designing and implementing data persistence solutions using relational databases like MySQL, as well as non-relational databases such as documentDB and DynamoDB.
Tech stack:
- Kotlin & Java 11/17
- SpringBoot & Spring
- Microservices & Monolith architectures
- RESTful APIs
- MySQL, DynamoDB
- Mockito/Mockk, Junit/TestNG, and Mockserver
- AWS Service: Lambda, S3, DocumentDB, DynamoDB
summary:
As a passionate software engineer, I am interested in not only coding but also code design, design patterns, system architecture, performance, code readability, maintainability, clean code, and team productivity. Additionally, I hold a degree in computer science and mathematics from the Hebrew University in Jerusalem.
Skills: Software Engineering, project management, Java, Kotlin, SpringBoot, Spring, TestNG, Gradle, TypeScript, JavaScript, NodeJs, AWS, Tech Leadership, Mentoring, Recruiting, Selenium, Puppeteer, WebDriverIO, Test Automation, Jenkins, Groovy, Python.
past_positions:
Automation Infrastructure Lead at Duda (1 Jul 2020 - 1 Sep 2022) [2.2 yrs]: As head of automation at Duda, I was responsible for:
* Developing an automation strategy for the company
* Providing technical project management, including determining what needed to be done, how it should be done, when it should be done, by whom, and how it should be aligned with Duda's engineering roadmap.
* Building an automation team by recruiting, coaching, mentoring, guiding, and advising automation engineers so that they could perform at their best. || Automation Infrastructure Engineer at Duda (1 Jul 2020 - 1 May 2022) [1.8 yrs]: As an automation infrastructure engineer, I developed, maintained, and improved Duda's existing test automation infrastructure. This involved handling a large, complex, and distributed codebase of over 200K lines of code. As a result of my work, our automation became more stable, performant, and reliable, allowing Duda to increase the number of daily deployments and improving the CI/CD process.
In addition to my infrastructure work, I led the implementation of a new automation tool that allowed Duda's developers to write and own e2e testing. As a result, all newly developed microservices and features on the monolith are now tested using this new tool and framework, and developers can write and own e2e tests. This has led to a change in the internal development process and the structure of the R&D organization.
Of course, I did not achieve all of this alone, and I worked closely with talented automation developers, architects, and DevOps professionals.
Tech stack:
* Java: Object-oriented programming, design patterns, and functional programming.
* TypeScript/JavaScript: Node.js ecosystem, libraries, code, and patterns.
* WebDriverIO and Puppeteer: Implementing Duda's new automation project.
* Selenium: Our main project is written using Selenium.
* Jenkins: Implemented and maintained jobs using the Groovy programming language.
* Applitools: Maintaining the Applitools SDK and libraries related to Applitools in our code.
* BrowserStack: Working with APIs to automate different browsers.
* Logzio: Test monitoring, tracking, and operational research.
* AWS: Mainly worked with services such as EC2, S3 and Lambda's.
* POCing and integrating new tools, frameworks and libraries.

headline: Chief Engineer @ Regulus - Counter unmanned aerial systems and Cyber Defense For Sensors | Automotive | Maritime | Aviation | Drones | Infrastructure | AI software driven warfare
current_description:
Highly responsible for strategic initiatives that include coordination of research, design, development, analysis, architecture definition and deployment of projects, products and technologies.
Lead projects and provide subject matter expertise to very senior levels of Systems Engineering. Apply modern best practices of a system's life-cycle (e.g. requirements, engineering designs, documentation, usability, integration, test, deployment, maintenance, troubleshooting, etc.)
Assess the relationship between systems engineering and the elements associated with systems integration, systems architectures, and systems requirements as well as risks, issues, assumptions, mitigation, and dependencies.
www.regulus.com
Regulus Cyber is the first company dealing with sensor security, enabling uninterrupted, continuous operation under malicious attacks or accidental interference to sensors.
From GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite System) to LiDAR and Radar, sensors are critical components across a wide range of applications: vehicles on the ground, airplanes in the air and ships at sea; and even critical infrastructure (telecom, power grids, financial institutions). Today, little is done to secure these sensors against spoofing and jamming attacks. The sensor threat is growing rapidly with real-world attacks happening across these multiple sectors and is expected to further grow as sensor-dependent systems become more connected and autonomous.
To face these threats, Regulus is developing Pyramid™ – a set of technologies aimed at solving this problem. The Pyramid is the first sensor cyber defense technology for vehicles, airplanes, ships and drones defending both communication and sensors from smart physical hacks such as spoofing and jamming.
Learn more at www.regulus.com
summary:
Regulus is the first company dealing with sensor security, enabling uninterrupted, continuous operation under malicious attacks or accidental interference to sensors such as GNSS, LiDAR and Radar.
Experienced in research and development of multidisciplinary high technology system. Had the privilege of leading exceptional people to goal achievement through the development of cutting-edge technology.
Defining and recruiting critical resources such as experienced manpower and technology, deep knowledge and involvement in all technical aspects of the products through the development and marketing stages.
I am an engineer that aspires to innovate, inspire and keep learning day by day. I believe that people that had achievements did not sit idle and wait for things to happen, quite the opposite, they stood up and made things happen. So it's simple, always keep doing even if it might be a failure, some of it will definitely succeed.

headline: RT/Embedded Software Engineer

Senior software developer in the IDS (Intrusion Detection System) group.

Develop with C++ (14), over Linux/Andriod OS in an Embedded system.
summary:
Experienced software developer with proven abilities in designing, managing, and developing software in a wide range of multi-disciplinary systems, that include hardware (circuits and ASICs), firmware, and multi-core processors.
Development was performed on different levels of the software stacks, ranging from low-level and up to high-level object-oriented development, over an operating system environment.
I have a passion for technology with self-learning capabilities and a proven ability to deal with complex problems.
I’m a team player with excellent interpersonal skills.
Development skills:
Programming Languages: C, C++(14, 17), Python
Operating Systems: Linux, VxWorks, eCos
Networking Protocols: Ethernet, IP, TCP/UDP, Telnet/SSH, FTP/TFTP, etc.
Environment: Agile methodology with up-to-date tracking tools such as Git, ClearCase, and Jira
past_positions:
Radio Software Team Leader at Ceragon Networks (1 Mar 2013 - 1 Jun 2022) [9.3 yrs]: Hands-on team leader of a Modem & Radio Frequency (RF) team, which is the core technology of the company.
The development includes the following:
● Next generation 5th generation ASIC - involvement in the silicon development process and development of a C++ SDK running on Linux over a MIPS core.
● Applications for ASIC hardware - boot and manager applications that interface with the processor peripherals, such as buses, memory modules, and interrupt controllers. Close cooperation with the VLSI, algorithm, and system teams. The applications are characterized by a small memory footprint with low CPU performance and are coded in C over the eCos OS over a MIPS core.
● Host applications that manage the product's mainboard – developed the functionality supplied by the ASIC cores. Development in C/C++ on Linux-embedded OS. || Senior Software Developer at Ceragon Networks (1 Dec 2004 - 1 Mar 2013) [8.2 yrs]: RT software development in embedded environments of modules such as - software downloader, license management, Ethernet and E1/T1 interfaces.
Development was performed in C on Linux embedded OS.

Over the past several years, I have honed my skills in 𝐛𝐚𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐧𝐝 𝐝𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐥𝐨𝐩𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭, 𝐬𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐦 𝐚𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞, and 𝐬𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬. My career journey has taken me from developing large-scale information retrieval systems to leading 𝐢𝐧𝐧𝐨𝐯𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞 projects in the cybersecurity domain. I thrive on 𝐬𝐨𝐥𝐯𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐧𝐠𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐦𝐬 and driving projects to success through 𝐬𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐢𝐜 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐧𝐤𝐢𝐧𝐠 and 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐥 𝐞𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐬𝐞.
One of my core competencies is system architecture and design. I excel at creating robust and scalable solutions, whether working with microservices or monolithic architectures. My experience includes leading the design and implementation of new services from scratch, enabling new data pipelines and diverse APIs. I leverage my architectural expertise to ensure that every project is built on a solid foundation, capable of handling growth and maintaining high uptime.
Another key area of my expertise is Test-Driven Development (𝐓𝐃𝐃) and software 𝐫𝐞𝐥𝐢𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲. I am a strong advocate for TDD methodologies, consistently contributing to the development of well-tested and reliable software. This approach ensures that the software I develop is not only functional but also reliable and maintainable.
In addition to my technical skills, I bring a strategic mindset to my work. I effectively balance product and executive-driven projects with self-initiated ones, demonstrating 𝐢𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐯𝐞 and a deep understanding of company goals. My ability to apply scalability and reliability principles to all projects ensures that the systems I build are resilient and prepared for future challenges. I am committed to delivering high-quality solutions that meet user needs and drive business success.
𝐈'𝐦 𝐨𝐩𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐨 𝐜𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐭 and meet virtually, so feel free to add me!

headline: Software Developer
location: Tel Aviv-Yafo, Tel Aviv District, Israel
current_description:
• Project owner responsible for all phases of the software development life cycle, including requirement gathering, system architecture, design, development and deploying to production.
• Work with C++, .NET (C#), ASP Core, JavaScript, and NodeJS, applying multithreading techniques to optimize application performance and scalability.
• Implemented REST APIs, gRPC services, SDKs, and external interfaces to enable efficient system integration.
• Developed the core engine functionality to implement user stories, ensuring alignment with product goals and requirements.
• Applied best practices in microservices and software design patterns (such as Factory), implementing algorithms like BFS and DFS.
• Worked with and set up Kafka as a message broker to handle event-driven communication between components.
• Reduced development compilation and dependency issues by 60%, improving efficiency across multiple development teams.
• Improved system performance and memory management, reducing major memory leaks and implementing performance-enhancing best practices.
• Worked with and migrated code across C++11 to C++14, and C++14 to C++20, modernizing the software.
• Mentored and onboarded developers on both Backend and Frontend teams, providing guidance and performing code reviews, and participated in design review sessions.
• Managed MongoDB and SQLite databases for data storage.
• Collaborated closely with global cross-functional teams, including developers, architects, QA, project managers, UX/UI, and clients.
• Built a POC with Kubernetes, showcasing container management and deployment solutions.
• Standardized processes and conducted effort estimation to enhance project efficiency.
• Working closely with the company’s software architect to migrate software products to cross platform compatibility (Linux, Virtual Machines, WSL) and updated development standard in C++.
summary:
With a strong focus on microservices architecture, design patterns, and multithreading, I optimize performance and scalability while modernizing software across C++ versions. I have successfully reduced compilation issues by 60%, mentored Backend and Frontend teams, and collaborated with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions. My experience extends to Kafka, MongoDB, SQLite, Kubernetes, and automating testing with Java and Azure DevOps.
I have developed GUI using ReactJS to create interactive, user-friendly interfaces and designed web applications that support user customization. Additionally, I have worked on developing custom mobile applications, integrating them with Monday.com for enhanced workflow management.
In addition to my engineering expertise, my in-depth experience as a QA Team Lead and QA Engineer provides me with a unique perspective and skill set that enhances my development work. This background enables me to approach development with a deeper understanding of quality assurance processes, ensuring more reliable and efficient software solutions.

The team is responsible for developing the Satori SaaS built on the Kubernetes cluster and acts as a reverse proxy between clients (database engineer, data ​​analyst, etc..) and databases (Snowflake, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, BigQuery, etc..).
The main application of the team is written in Rust and responsible for handling the clients database traffic (HTTPS based/ binary) and applies the Satori values such as:
Query manipulation, Resultset masking, Data classification, Inventory, Audit, etc...

Building the foundation & infrastructure of the Runtime team:
Development cycle - CI/CD, Helm deployment, In house python tool to support local development.

Developing in Rust language (asynchronous programming, Tokio).
Private fork for Nginx and manipulate the Nginx stream to support the architecture of the Satori SaaS cluster.
Developing real-time modules such as Data classification, Data Inventory, Data Masking.
Developing real-time analysis for the SQL queries to support Satori Security policy.
Maintain & monitor production events, Participate in customer technical calls, fix bugs, etc...

headline: Hisses like Python, bites right in the Node

current_description:
A breakdown of some of my past responsibilities! YES I DID ALL THESE!
* Data Engineering and Analysis: Developed and deployed data tagging and pipelines, automated data reporting systems, delegated with analyst duties dealing with data and tagging quality.
* Automated verification reducing manual efforts: Developed a C# and WPF-based application to automate QA verification processes.
* Android Mobile Development: Created Android applications using Java and Kotlin, to ensure full compliance with the Standards Institution of Israel’s requirements.
* Smart Device Integration: Contributed to the development of a companion app for peripheral smart embedded devices using React Native and Typescript, improving user interaction and system integration.
* OTA Automation: Automated over-the-air (OTA) updates for embedded C device components, enhancing update processes and reducing manual intervention, ultimately improving overall system efficiency.
* Software Development: Python, Typescript, Powershell, Linux, Windows, Google Cloud, AWS, Docker
Data & Machine Learning: Data Pipelines, Statistical analysis, Power Query, Power BI, Tableau, Excel, SQL, Postgresql
summary:
Building software that works isn’t just my job—it’s my passion. Whether it’s for embedded devices, designing a React Native app, or crafting a seamless data pipeline with Python, I thrive on creating systems that solve real-world problems.
I’ve tackled everything from software development to QA, and even pitched in on device manufacturing—proof that I’m not afraid to roll up my sleeves when the situation demands. But my favorite moments? They’re when I get to develop something meaningful for users, blending technology with utility.
In the future, I hope to dive deeper into large-scale systems, honing my expertise and tackling challenges that demand creativity and precision. And when I’m not coding, you’ll find me crafting (both physically and digitally) or spending time with my cats—pursuits that spark creativity and keep me grounded.
I’m excited about the chance to bring my unique mix of skills and perspective Let’s create something amazing together!

headline: Software Engineer at Kahun
location: Or Yehuda, Tel Aviv District, Israel
summary:
I was always fascinated by the opportunity to build a “thinking creature” into a computing machine. When phones became really smart with lots of sensors inside and strong computing power, this was the best platform for me. Since then, I was involved in projects that aimed to make the phone into something more than a communication device, such as a tool that helps people with all kinds of activities.
After spending long years in various technology projects (especially around mobile code scanning, image recognition, etc.), I gained some insight into the main hurdles that prevent individuals as well as businesses from using such ideas to the full extent. Currently, I am involved in a product (or a platform) that tries to solve this problem and help businesses to put these technologies to use within their business. Such platform can help businesses to easily create mobile activities for a variety of processes that are currently done without mobile, including marketing activities and other operational activities.

headline: Delivering software solutions for a growing renewable energy market.
current_description:
I've been a software developer at FSIGHT for six years. I'm principally involved in the back-end development of our signature product — Energy AI. This includes creating the decision tree machine learning algorithms that form the backbone of our energy prediction solution. I am also involved with data acquisition and optimization and collaborate with our UI developers. Additional software engineering responsibilities include:
- Rest & Soap API – implementing communication with customer servers
- Database – MySQL, Hibernate, and JPA
- Spring Framework
- Git
I wear multiple hats at FSIGHT, interfacing with customers, managing our development team, and implementing internal paradigms for cross-team communication.
summary:
As a software engineer and team leader at FSIGHT, I'm part of a global effort to strengthen the green energy market. For me, it's about more than developing software — I create solutions that reduce energy consumption and contribute to a cleaner world.
I've been a software developer and engineer for more than 15 years. I love my career because every day I use my skills to solve real-world problems such as climate change. For the last six years, I've been intimately involved in developing the crucial back-end components for our signature product—Energy AI. FSIGHT Predict uses state-of-the-art artificial intelligence and machine learning technology to automatically forecast electricity consumption and the generation of individual endpoints or aggregated portfolios.
My priorities are always delivering high-quality solutions that focus on the customer's needs. A customer-first outlook enables me to develop tools that empower utilities, power producers, grid operators, and energy retailers worldwide.

In my role as software developer, I developed a Linux Embedded environment running on an ARM processor. - Bash script programming.
I was involved in design, the creation of user manuals, and the definition of software requirements.

headline: Software Engineer at Cyberbit
current_description:
I’m a Software engineer at Cyberbit.
We are a global startup with a unique mission: maximizing the performance of cyber security teams, so they can be fully prepared to defend their organizations.
We address one of the most acute industry problems: information security teams are unprepared to respond to attacks, because they will only experience them while on the job.
We are building the first hyper-realistic cyber security skills development platform that simulates cyber attacks, delivering the closest possible experience to a real-world incident. Leading enterprises use our platform to ensure their teams are ready for attacks. Universities use our platform to provide next-generation cyber education programs. Cyberbit is the global leading cyber security skill development platform, delivering over 500,000 sessions annually across 5 continents. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, leading telecom operators, MSSPs and system integrators, police departments, governments, and militaries. We are headquartered in Israel with offices in the US, Europe, and Asia.

headline: Software Developer & Data Engineer at Kaleidoo | Python, SQL, GCP, ML/DL
current_description:
Developed robust Microservices using FastAPI and managed API integrations.
Built event-driven microservices for automated Data processing and transformation.
Skilled in using Firestore and MongoDB for managing and indexing unstructured data.
Managed structured data storage and real-time querying with Google Cloud SQL, ideal for large-scale data analysis.
Orchestrated complex ETL workflows and data pipelines using Airflow (Python) and managed cloud-based setups with Cloud Composer.
Implemented version control, branch management, and CI/CD integrations for continuous delivery.
Designed real-time dashboards for impactful Data visualization and strategic decision-making.
Expert in crafting complex SQL queries for data extraction, manipulation, and reporting, especially within BigQuery.
Developed and deployed an API for face detection and recognition using deep learning models, managing both training and prediction on Google Cloud’s Vertex AI platform as well as on-premises. Designed scalable solutions for deep learning model training and inference, ensuring high performance and accuracy across diverse deployment environments.
Independently led a full-cycle technology project from inception to delivery, including selecting appropriate technologies, designing and implementing the solution, and engaging directly with the customer to understand requirements and ensure alignment with the chosen technical approach
summary:
I work as a Software Developer and Data Engineer at Kaleidoo, where I specialize in data analysis using BigQuery, building scalable cloud-based solutions, and managing real-time data processing for big data applications. My role also includes implementing ML/DL models, creating BI reports with Looker, and developing backend APIs.
I hold a Practical Software Engineering degree from the Technion - Israel Institute of Technology in Haifa. Additionally, I have completed courses and gained extensive knowledge in AI, Machine Learning, and Deep Learning. I am also a certified Google Cloud Architect.
I am deeply passionate about technology and love developing new solutions that can enhance human well-being, particularly in the realm of data. I believe in the power of data to drive meaningful change and innovation.

headline: Computer & Software Engineer
current_description: I work at the Infrastructure team implementing different routing protocols in our Cluster manager and in Linux
summary:
I think what best describes me is that I love what I do. It doesn't really matter what it is, after getting into it I enjoy it and try to perfect it and myself.
During my BA in Computer Engineering I built a radial 3D printer as my final project which I found fascinating. This led me to my first job at IO-Tech as the main software developer in the startup for 2.5 years developing the software for new 3D printing technologies.
In IO-Tech I had the privilege of having the best CTO one could hope for, who gave me the trust and freedom to be creative and grow in however I saw best for the company. This gave me the opportunity of learning and expanding my horizon.
In parallel, I had the chance to start studding my MA in Computer Science with Prof. Yuval Kochman as thesis advisor focusing on optimizing binary hypothesis testing of optical signals with a photon detector, which was challenging (to say the least) but nevertheless very satisfying.
Lastly, in addition to my interest in the engineering world, I am as well a semi-pro photographer (see ik-art.com), I won first place in the chess tournament of Jerusalem for junior high school and learned the piano for almost 20 years.

headline: Development Team Lead
current_description:
In parallel to my existing responsibilities, I was entrusted with an additional high-priority project, overseeing its day-to-day development and modernization while maintaining a high standard of quality:
Redesigned a large-scale ETL system integrating 14 APIs, achieving significant performance improvements through:
1. Parallel processing to efficiently handle multiple API calls.
2. Redis caching to minimize redundant requests and prevent rate limits.
3. Exponential back-off strategies for robust error handling and retry mechanisms.
4. Restructuring the project into modular components, enhancing scalability and maintainability.
Optimized AWS infrastructure, reducing monthly costs by 80% through:
1. Migrating services from EC2 instances to Fargate Serverless for cost and performance efficiency.
2. Introducing Terraform with DRY (Don’t Repeat Yourself) principles to overhaul and streamline cloud architecture.
3. Enhancing security by applying industry best practices for access control and environment protection.
Managed and mentored a team of 2-3 developers, fostering collaboration, providing technical guidance, and ensuring the successful delivery of the project.

Today, I’m dedicated to building robust systems, making thoughtful architectural decisions, and continually improving as a developer. I’m always eager to explore new technologies, deepen my expertise, and take on the next meaningful challenge.

My work directly contributes to enhancing our product, providing customers with the full value of our AI CFO solution — an advanced system that helps eCommerce businesses achieve sustainable growth through strategic funding and planning.
In my role, I focus on backend development, utilizing cutting-edge technologies such as TypeScript , AWS Serverless , and the Nest.js framework to create robust and scalable systems. I am also responsible for the development and maintenance of our accounting system, a mission-critical function that ensures our finance department has reliable access to accurate, real-time financial data. This includes automating workflows, improving operational efficiency, and supporting informed decision-making within the company.
Working at the intersection of technology and financial services has been a unique and rewarding experience, allowing me to deepen my understanding of financial systems while delivering impactful solutions. By building and improving core capabilities within the 8fig platform, I contribute to the growth and success of both our customers and our team.

headline: backend developer sidelines
summary:
The first time I programmed it was a test question for admission to a particular course, the assignment was in an invented language based on the c language I had to create a function that gets a number and strong and returns the number strongly
In high school, I studied physics and chemistry and in the army, I did not engage in the field in any way so I had no background, and for all that I just returned from the big trip to the East.
I sat there in class and just started thinking looking at a page that explains how to use the invented language to write an idea and vice versa.
i spent two hours as a blink of an eye I enjoyed every moment in this challenge and realized this is the field I want to deal with in my life, unfortunately, I did not pass the exam.
I found a program called Talpiot High-Tech where I underwent 2000 hours of training in which in the first months I learned c # object oriented winform and did fun projects like chess and checkers with UI.
Later in the course, I chose to study web development which started with reading eloquent javascript challenging book which goes over many concepts in language, I learned about inheriting js from the book the principles of object-oriented javascript, and then I did some vanilla javascript HTML CSS projects and progressed to learning technologies like react class-based and react hooks I learned redux and learned side server technologies like node js java spring working with MySQL and MongoDB with mongoose, In addition, I got to use AWS cloud services like s3 rds lamda.
The program Talpiot High-Tech was in-depth and challenging.
At the end of my program, I found a job at a company called 015 the company Is the company that I work for today where I was exposed to new and interesting things like vue.js feather.js rabbitmq minio, and more.
I am very happy in choosing a profession programmer profession that constantly has somewhere to strive to advance and develop

headline: Software Engineer & Technology Enthusiast
summary:
I am a software engineer from Israel, who constantly seeks new and interesting ways to grow his childhood passion for computers and technology into a successful career. My life goal is to become an experienced software engineer and architect, whose skills, software systems and experience can be relied upon, and whose work is indistinguishable from the work of art.
Today, I know many different programming languages of all levels (mostly imperative). C/C++ and parallelism do not scare me, nor does Linux without a GUI (I also know how to use vim). I am very security-aware, and so are my code practices. Living on the Internet since '97 also made me very familiar with various network protocols, as did prior experience in writing Android-based VPN software from scratch in Java and C.
I am a very practical person: I like to play with things and write code in order to learn my way around a system rather than just read or hear about it. I also have a strong intuition in problem solving and often understand the language computers use to communicate issues to the user (when they do). For the problems I am not familiar with, I usually know what to search for online to eventually come up with a solution or at least a workaround.

headline: Fullstack developer
location: Bat Yam, Tel Aviv District, Israel
summary:
Hi there, I'm a passionate programmer on the lookout for exciting opportunities as a fullstack software developer, with a particular penchant for back-end.
🎖️ My journey in technology began with participating in the military academic program Atuda. From 2017 to 2021, I served as a Full Stack Programmer (Java, C# / Wpf, Angular) where I contributed to the development of Electronic Warfare systems for the IDF. During this time, I wore multiple hats, serving as a Scrum Master and effectively leading our team, even if it wasn't an official title. The last two years of my military service were spent at Elbit Systems, and it culminated with an honorary discharge at the rank of Captain.
🤝 Since transitioning from the military, I've been engaged in solo projects for various social associations as part of Enter Digital Studio. These projects have allowed me to apply my programming skills for the betterment of different communities.
🎓 Currently, I'm a student pursuing a B.Sc. in Computer Sciences and Mathematics at Tel Aviv University, with just two math courses left to complete my degree.
🌟 Beyond my technical abilities, I bring strong organizational and interpersonal skills to the table. I thrive in team environments and believe in fostering a professional yet very friendly and inclusive atmosphere in the workplace.
I'm excited to connect with professionals and explore opportunities that align with my skills and passion for software development.

headline: Philosopher
current_description: Backend development
summary:
I'm a mostly-autodidact low-level developer and hacker, specializing in research and C and Go development for various platforms.
In addition, I enjoy kernel hacking, porting (*nix to *nix, *nix to Windows and vice versa), development of cross-platform build systems, embedding or development of interpreters and distro development.
Since 2007 or so, when I entered this field as a self-taught teenager, I've contributed to many open source software projects. I've been involved with Puppy Linux for many years (since 2008?) and contributed to Devuan, mostly in the areas of C development, shell scripting, hacking & upstreaming of open-source work, automation (packaging, image generation, kernel patching, cross-compilation) and porting (*BSD to Linux, x86 to ARM, etc'). I even had my own Linux distro, called RLSD.
I'm dedicated, professional, fast-thinking and do the things I do with tons of passion and endless curiosity. My strong intuition, exceptional attention to detail and analytic approach to problem solving, alongside the constant need to do things in new and creative ways, are my greatest assets when I wear the software engineer hat.
In my spare time, I study philosophy, play lead trumpet and flugelhorn. Philosophy teaches me how to attack complex problems with zero or little prior knowledge, ask questions and think different, while music inspires me and fuels my creativity.

headline: I manage your wealth and large investment capitals | Financial Modeling | Private Equity
summary:
Are you an Investor, Entrepreneur or Expert Professional? If so, I offer you a realistic and specific scenario, aimed at optimizing the management of your assets and liabilities, as well as solving specific stock transactions within the stock market.
My name is Danyo Chane, and as an experienced investment professional my value proposition is based on a single, undistracted objective: to create a solid mid and large cap management, trading highly liquid listed assets within a regulated financial market.
If your aspirations are...
✔ To own the management of your wealth within investments, through a team of highly trained and prepared professionals.
✔ To reduce risks (and therefore costs), automating processes with the most sophisticated instruments and constantly optimizing a high return on investment.
✔ Be a participant in our financial analysis (we study your portfolio, analyze risks through indexes, alerts and special protections and manage them in the best way committed to eliminate any contingency).
✔ Obtain economic benefits when stock market operations (previously studied through advanced statistical analysis) generate a capital gain.
⌚️ Then I certainly suggest you contact me!
👉 Are you looking to land your investments in the big markets? We set up a robust structure suitable for the stable growth of your capital.
👉 Do you want to establish yourself on the stock market? The scenario we propose to you focuses especially on the company and management of your assets for your business installation (local or foreign) in a solid, intelligent and profitable way.
📣 Send me a direct message if you want to know more and let's continue the conversation there to see if my process and strategy could work for you. Let's grow your wealth and reach your financial and business goals together.
